tag.name: file
tag.description: Classes for making OAuth signed requests to the miiCard API.

docblock.description: Houses the URLs of the OAuth endpoint and Claims API endpoint.
URL of the OAuth authorisation endpoint.
URL of the Claims API v1 JSON endpoint.
Calculates the URL of a Claims API method.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The name of the API method to be invoked.

docblock.description: Base class for classes that make OAuth 1.0a-signed HTTP requests
The OAuth consumer key.
The OAuth consumer secret.
The OAuth access token, if known.
The OAuth access token secret, if known.
Initialises a new OAuthSignedRequestMaker with specified key and secret.
docblock.long-description: A consumer key and secret are mandatory - without them an InvalidArgumentException is thrown. The caller may supply an access token and secret if they are known, or omit them if they intend to make requests that aren't signed by an access token and secret (for example, as would be the case during an initial OAuth exchange).

tag.name: param
tag.description: The OAuth consumer key obtained by request from miiCard.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The OAuth consumer secret obtained by request from miiCard.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The OAuth access token obtained by performing an OAuth exchange.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The OAuth access token secret obtained by performing an OAuth exchange.

docblock.description: Gets the OAuth consumer key.
Gets the OAuth consumer secret.
Gets the OAuth access token, or NULL if not set.
Gets the OAuth access token secret, or NULL if not set.
Makes an OAuth-signed HTTP POST request.
docblock.long-description: Makes signed requests both during the initial OAuth exchange (where OAuth parameters are sent form-encoded as part of the body of the request, with $raw_post_body = FALSE) and afterwards when accessing the API (when JSON- encoded parameters are sent raw in the body of the request).

tag.name: param
tag.description: The URL to be requested.

tag.name: param
tag.description: An array of parameters to be sent with the request as a post body (if $raw_post_body = FALSE), or a string containing the raw post body to be sent (if $raw_post_body = TRUE).

tag.name: param
tag.description: Additional HTTP headers to be sent with the request.

tag.name: param
tag.description: If TRUE, $params is interpreted as pre-parsed content to be dropped into the body of the request as-is. If FALSE, the default, $params is interpreted as an array of key-value pairs to be form-encoded and sent in the body of the request.

docblock.description: Makes an HTTP Post request, returning the response.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The URL to be requested.

tag.name: param
tag.description: An array of parameters to be sent with the request as a post body (if $raw_post_body = FALSE), or a string containing the raw post body to be sent (if $raw_post_body = TRUE).

tag.name: param
tag.description: Additional HTTP headers to be sent with the request.

tag.name: param
tag.description: If TRUE, $params is interpreted as pre-parsed content to be dropped into the body of the request as-is. If FALSE, the default, $params is interpreted as an array of key-value pairs to be form-encoded and sent in the body of the request.

docblock.description: Base class for exceptions raised by the library.
Base class for wrappers around an OAuth-protected API.
Initialises a new MiiCardOAuthServiceBase with specified OAuth credentials.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The OAuth consumer key.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The OAuth consumer secret.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The OAuth access token.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The OAuth access token secret.

docblock.description: Wrapper around the miiCard Claims API v1.
docblock.long-description: This class wraps the miiCard Claims API v1, exposing the same methods as PHP functions and return types as PHP objects rather than raw JSON.

docblock.description: Initialises an MiiCardOAuthClaimsService with specified OAuth credentials.
docblock.long-description: If any constructor parameters are omitted, an InvalidArgumentException shall be thrown.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The OAuth consumer key.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The OAuth consumer secret.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The OAuth access token.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The OAuth access token secret.

docblock.description: Gets the claims that the miiCard member has shared with your application.
Gets whether the miiCard member owns a particular social media account.
docblock.long-description: The social media account is identified by the specified ID and type, and getting this information is dependent on their having shared details of that account with your application.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The ID of the user on the social network in question as supplied by that social network - see the miiCard Developers site API documentation for more details.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The network on which thr miiCard member may have an account - see the miiCard Developers site API documentation for more details.

docblock.description: Gets whether the miiCard member's identity has been assured by miiCard.
Gets an image representation of the miiCard member's identity status.

tag.name: param
tag.description: One of 'banner', 'badge-small' or 'badge' that determines the size and content of the assurance image.

docblock.description: Gets details of snapshots matching an ID.
docblock.long-description: If no snapshot ID is supplied, details about all snapshots taken by your application for the user are returned.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The unique identifier of the snapshot for which details should be retrieved, or NULL if details of all snapshots should be retrieved.

docblock.description: Gets the snapshot of a miiCard member's identity by its ID.
docblock.long-description: To discover existing snapshots, use the getIdentitySnapshotDetails function.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The unique identifier of the snapshot for which details should be retrieved.

docblock.description: Gets a PDF of an identity snapshot.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The unique identifier of the snapshot for which details should be retrieved.

docblock.description: Makes an OAuth signed request to the specified Claims API method.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The name of the Claims API method to invoke.

tag.name: param
tag.description: JSON string of parameter data required by the API method, if any.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Callable to be invoked to process the payload of the response, if any.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Specifies whether the response from the API is wrapped in a MiiApiResponse object (TRUE), or is a raw stream (FALSE).

tag.name: param
tag.description: Specifies that the payload of the response is an array-type - examples would be the GetIdentitySnapshotDetails call which returns an array of IdentitySnapshotDetails objects.

docblock.description: Wrapper around the miiCard OAuth authorisation process.
The callback URL that the OAuth process will return to once completed.
Sets whether to force the user to re-select information to share.
Builds a new MiiCard object using the supplied OAuth credentials.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The OAuth consumer key.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The OAuth consumer secret.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The OAuth access token.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The OAuth access token secret.

docblock.description: Gets the access token with which requests should be signed.
Gets the access token secret with which requests should be signed.
Gets the default callback URL to return to once the OAuth flow completes.
Starts an OAuth authorisation process.
docblock.long-description: Your script must not have sent any HTML content to the browser at the point when this is called, and should have called session_start().

tag.name: param
tag.description: The URL that should be returned to after the OAuth process completes. This is automatically detected if not supplied.

docblock.description: Determines if the current request is an OAuth callback.
docblock.long-description: The caller should check this function on each page load of the callback page, and attempt to handle the OAuth callback only in the event that it returns TRUE.

docblock.description: Processes the OAuth callback, obtaining an access token and secret.
docblock.long-description: The caller should check the return value of the isAuthorisationSuccess function after trying to handle the callback.

docblock.description: Determines if obtaining OAuth access token and secret information suceeded.
docblock.long-description: If TRUE, the caller can obtain the two tokens using the getAccessToken and getAccessTokenSecret functions.

docblock.description: Gets the identity claims the miiCard member elected to share.
docblock.long-description: This is a convenience method, and building a MiiCardOAuthClaimsService object is the preferred approach.

docblock.description: Clears any OAuth credentials that might be stored.
docblock.long-description: This is called automatically by the beginAuthorisation method.

docblock.description: Obtains an OAuth request token from the miiCard OAuth endpoint.
Converts a request token into a fully-fledged access token.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The server supplied verifier that signifies the request token has been authorised by the miiCard member.

docblock.description: Attempts to make sure that session state is available.

parse_markers.critical: No short description for file miiCard.Consumers\miiCard.Consumers.php
parse_markers.error: Argument $force_claims_picker is missing from the Docblock of __construct()

docblock.description: Represents different possible statuses returned by the miiCard API.
Signifies that the API call was successful.
Signifies that the API call failed.
docblock.long-description: More detail may be found by interrogating the MiiApiResponse's getErrorCode function.

docblock.description: Represents the specific error type returned by the miiCard API.
Signifies that there was no error.
Signifies that the miiCard member has revoked access to your app.
docblock.long-description: Your application needs to make the member go through the OAuth process again to obtain fresh access tokens if you wish to use the API on their behalf.

docblock.description: Signifies that the user can't share data due to a lapsed subscription.
Signifies that your account is not on the transactional model.
Signifies that your account's transactional status is development-only.
docblock.long-description: This is the case when your application hasn't yet been made live in the miiCard system, for example while we process your billing details and perform final checks.

docblock.description: Signifies that the snapshot ID was either invalid.
docblock.long-description: The ID may not exist, or doesn't belong to the user whose access tokens were used to make the API request.

docblock.description: Signifies that your application has been suspended.
docblock.long-description: No API access can take place until miiCard releases the suspension on your application.

docblock.description: Signifies that your application has been disabled.
docblock.long-description: Your applications can be disabled either by your request or by miiCard. miiCard members will be unable to go through the OAuth process for your application, though you will still be able to access the API.

docblock.description: Signifies that your application has been deleted.
docblock.long-description: miiCard members will be unable to go through the OAuth process for your application, nor will you be able to access identity details through the API.

docblock.description: Signifies that a more general exception took place during the call.
docblock.long-description: Further information may be available by calling the MiiApiResponse's getErrorMessage() function.

docblock.description: Details the kind of web property a user has linked to their miiCard profile.
The WebProperty object describes a domain name.
The WebProperty object describes a website.

docblock.description: A wrapper around most responses to miiCard Claims API calls.
docblock.long-description: Also details the success or failure of the call and containing additional information to help diagnose issues.

docblock.description: Initialises a new MiiApiResponse object.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The overall status of the API call, linked to one of the constants of the MiiApiCallStatus class.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The error code that describes any error that occurred during the API call, linked to one of the constants of the MiiApiErrorCode class.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Additional error message optionally supplied for certain types of API error. Intended for diagnostics only and strictly not suitable for display to the public.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The payload of the response, whose type will vary depending on the API method being called.

docblock.description: Gets the overall status of the API call.
docblock.long-description: Linked to one of the constants of the MiiApiCallStatus class.

docblock.description: Gets the error code that describes any error during API access.

docblock.long-description: Intended for diagnostics only and strictly not suitable for display to the public.

docblock.description: Gets the payload of the response.
Gets whether the user is currently marked as a tester.
docblock.long-description: Identity assurance checks are skipped for test users for development purposes - your production code should check this field and reject test accounts as appropriate.

docblock.description: key = the token secret = the token secret
generates the basic string serialization of a token that a server would respond to request_token and access_token calls with
A class for implementing a Signature Method See section 9 ("Signing Requests") in the spec
Needs to return the name of the Signature Method (ie HMAC-SHA1)
Build up the signature NOTE: The output of this function MUST NOT be urlencoded.
docblock.long-description: the encoding is handled in OAuthRequest when the final request is serialized

docblock.description: Verifies that a given signature is correct

The HMAC-SHA1 signature method uses the HMAC-SHA1 signature algorithm as defined in [RFC2104] where the Signature Base String is the text and the key is the concatenated values (each first encoded per Parameter Encoding) of the Consumer Secret and Token Secret, separated by an '&' character (ASCII code 38) even if empty.
docblock.long-description: • Chapter 9.2 ("HMAC-SHA1")

docblock.description: The PLAINTEXT method does not provide any security protection and SHOULD only be used over a secure channel such as HTTPS.
docblock.long-description: It does not use the Signature Base String. - Chapter 9.4 ("PLAINTEXT")

docblock.description: oauth_signature is set to the concatenated encoded values of the Consumer Secret and Token Secret, separated by a '&' character (ASCII code 38), even if either secret is empty.
docblock.long-description:
The result MUST be encoded again. - Chapter 9.4.1 ("Generating Signatures")

Please note that the second encoding MUST NOT happen in the SignatureMethod, as OAuthRequest handles this!

docblock.description: The RSA-SHA1 signature method uses the RSASSA-PKCS1-v1_5 signature algorithm as defined in [RFC3447] section 8.2 (more simply known as PKCS#1), using SHA-1 as the hash function for EMSA-PKCS1-v1_5.
docblock.long-description: It is assumed that the Consumer has provided its RSA public key in a verified way to the Service Provider, in a manner which is beyond the scope of this specification. - Chapter 9.3 ("RSA-SHA1")

docblock.description: attempt to build up a request from what was passed to the server
pretty much a helper function to set up the request
The request parameters, sorted and concatenated into a normalized string.
Returns the base string of this request
docblock.long-description: The base string defined as the method, the url and the parameters (normalized), each urlencoded and the concated with &.

docblock.description: just uppercases the http method
parses the url and rebuilds it to be scheme://host/path
builds a url usable for a GET request
builds the data one would send in a POST request
builds the Authorization: header
util function: current timestamp
util function: current nonce
process a request_token request returns the request token on success
process an access_token request returns the access token on success
verify an api call, checks all the parameters
version 1
figure out the signature with some defaults
try to find the consumer for the provided request's consumer key
try to find the token for the provided request's token key
all-in-one function to check the signature on a request should guess the signature method appropriately
check that the timestamp is new enough
check that the nonce is not repeated

docblock.description: Ensures that a full user profile can be deserialised.

General assertions for all test cases related to user profiles.
